6.87.text: A very common question that is presented to me is “What is your authentic self?”

10.75.text: And our authentic self is that actual first breath that we take into our body.

17.12.text: It’s the breath of life. It’s the I behind all of your thoughts, behind all of your emotions.

23.82.text: It’s the force that animates you and gives you life.

28.02.text: And that authentic self, is spirit.

31.19.text: It’s the eternal, timeless and limitless self that we all are.

37.95.text: And when we lose touch with that, we start looking for ourselves in the reflections of the world around us.

47.11.text: People and approval and standards of whatever is popular at the time.

54.01.text: But even though we look, we never feel satisfied or grounded or at ease.

60.00.text: Somehow, artificial and insecure. So when we connect with that breath and we

67.00.text:
remember, which actually means to bring
back into.

70.90.text: Remember. Become part of that breath, that self.

77.45.text: as though we’re entering into integrity and wholeness.

81.04.text:
It's so important to connect with your
spirit in order to find your true

85.68.text: purpose to find your happiness, because

88.26.text: it is the only place where you can

91.90.text:
actually make contact with your true
purpose. Which is to actually be your

97.30.text: best self. Your most genuine self.

101.30.text: And if you’re not coming from a place of your spirit,

104.78.text:
you're missing that. It's like being at a
false bottom or not really bringing

109.84.text: forward who you are. If you’re coming from your ego self,

113.92.text: you’re coming from a self that you’ve manufactured in order to survive the gauntlet of life.

119.70.text: And it’s not a genuine or comfortable or truly available self.

128.90.text: The ego self is by nature defended and pushes life away, so you can’t

134.12.text: really make contact and bring your gifts forward when you are working out of that context.

139.95.text: When you’re in your spirit, you naturally open up,

143.17.text: you naturally want to make contact with life, bring forward your gifts,

147.22.text: and receive the gifts of others.

150.76.text: And that’s the natural way. There are four stages to

155.41.text: finding our way back to our authentic self.

159.47.text: So as I lay them out, you might want to reflect on

162.87.text: what stage you might be in. The first stage I call the Awakening Stage.

167.50.text: And that is, that point either brought about by a crisis or just some

173.77.text: existential angst where you don’t feel good that

177.45.text: that something in you can no longer be ignored.

180.80.text: You feel like, “The life I’m living, the person I’m being, is not

186.47.text:
making me happy and something's gotta
give."

190.62.text: Some people say they get this awakening

194.02.text: when they have a near death experience or a crisis or a loss of a job or marriage or

200.66.text: Or maybe you just wake up one day too many in a funk.

204.30.text: But the point is when you start awakening,

207.93.text: you can’t go back to sleep. You have to follow that

212.17.text: signal or that impulse. And it’s

215.23.text: bigger than your mind. It’s something organic.

219.40.text:
It’s inside your being. 
And that leads us to the second stage.

223.61.text: And the second stage is what brings a lot of people to me.

227.09.text: That stage is what I call the Discovery Phase.

231.82.text: So now we wanna look. Now we’re looking for answers and we begin to search,

236.81.text: we begin to read books, we begin to

239.01.text: listen to seminars or watch television shows or

243.15.text: broadcasts or listen to radio shows that people are talking about

248.09.text: an awakening. This part serves two purposes.

254.50.text: One, it tells you you’re not crazy.

256.88.text: It tells you that you’re not making it up. That other people are

261.25.text:
seeking the same deeper answers, a
deeper

265.24.text: sense of being. So it gives you confidence.

268.47.text: And two, it gives you direction. You actually begin

272.24.text: to become educated. That there is a self beyond the ego,

277.13.text: beyond the people’s feelings or approval. And

280.31.text: the more you you tune into that...

284.62.text: it’s like the garden, the seeds of your true self start

289.49.text: gestating, and they start sprouting and begin to take on

294.18.text: a life of their own. So

297.87.text: the more you discover, the more that inner self awakens and

301.22.text:
develops and grows. And you start to
feel

306.51.text: like you’re coming back to who you really are.

312.04.text: Which leads us to the third phase. The third phase is

316.22.text: the voice or the guidance that influences your life is no longer one

320.57.text: that you’re pulling from other people. That you’re actually starting to

326.16.text: hear, but I use that word

331.18.text: loosely, because it’s not really a hear with your ears. It’s like an

335.12.text: inner hearing or an inner feeling or an

339.32.text: inner guidance that it begins to direct you.

343.33.text: And it begins to actually, often go against the grain

346.84.text: of everything you’ve been told and everything you’ve been influenced by.

353.20.text:
It starts giving you
information that

356.30.text: may not even make intellectual sense. “Do this! Go there!

359.76.text: Quit your job! Take an airplane! Fly across the world!” Whatever.

364.78.text: And at that point you have to come to a decision. You

368.95.text: actually have to make a choice. You either

372.25.text: continue to swim upstream against the grain of who you are

376.15.text: or you surrender to that voice.

380.66.text: it feels for some initially, like it’s just a free fall.

388.01.text: the construct of your world as you know it.

392.25.text: And yet, when you begin to actually

396.09.text: find that courage… and I like that word because it’s from a Latin word and

401.24.text: a French word “Coeur”, which means your heart.

404.19.text: Find that connection to your heart! The actual experience of surrendering is very calm.

411.38.text: It’s very healing. It’s very uplifting and it

414.60.text: opens up this whole other world for you. This world where life

419.29.text: supports you rather than you trying to manage it.

422.80.text: You begin to have synchronistic events you begin to

425.85.text: have spontaneous and quite wonderful openings.

430.45.text: And that leads you to the fourth phase, which is Flow.

434.00.text: And that’s where you live without

436.92.text: thinking, where you actually just find

440.30.text: yourself moving from a place of a deeper wisdom than

444.89.text: your intellectual, rational mind can manufacture.

449.20.text: It’s also something that… I also like to call it a state of grace.

454.05.text: You just like show up. Right place, right time, synchronicities.

457.84.text: It just seems like life becomes a hand in glove experience.

461.40.text: And it’s available to all of us.

465.27.text: But we have to move through those four stages.

469.03.text: And it can be in one foul swoop

472.18.text: or you dig your way toward it

475.63.text: with as much resistance as you wanna put into it,

479.13.text: but eventually we’re all gonna move in that direction
